unit_learning_outcomes.description: Critique and reflect on one's own professional practice and that of their peers.
Think critically about the potential of information and communication technologies to enhance the quality of learning and teaching.
Understand the changing curriculum context in Australia.
Cater for the diverse needs of learners, especially those from non-English speaking backgrounds, Indigenous students and those with special needs.
Develop an understanding of important contextual aspects of professional practice including: effective teaching, curriculum differentiation, classroom management, and assessment and evaluation.
Understand the knowledge and skills required to plan lessons that actively engage students in learning.
Develop a basic working knowledge of the relevant syllabus documents.
Display a knowledge of the legislative requirements of the Child Protection Act.

enrolment_rules.description: Admission to BEd(Sec) or ((130cp at 1000 level or above) including (EDUC1050 or EDUC105) and (EDUC106 or EDUC1060) and (EDUC267 or EDUC2670))

assessments.description: Students are required to use the 4Rs model of reflective thinking to respond to the task question. Students will return to their reflection at multiple points throughout the semester to annotate for the development or shift in knowledge, skill or perception. (1,500)

Students are required to prepare a range of teaching resources relevant to their discipline area. Teaching resources may include: lesson plans, teaching resources, programs, assessment tasks. Students will justify portfolio items drawing on relevant research literature and discuss strategies for communicating effectively with parents/carers. (3,500)
